Define a Cryptol module `Array` that introduces a primitive `Array` type and its primitive operations (constant, lookup, update, equality, copy, set, rangeEqual), and specifies the derived functions `arrayRangeLookup` and `arrayRangeUpdate` with appropriate type constraints and behavior as in the given interface.

```cryptol
module Array where

primitive type Array : * -> * -> *

primitive arrayConstant : {a, b} b -> (Array a b)
primitive arrayLookup : {a, b} (Array a b) -> a -> b
primitive arrayUpdate : {a, b} (Array a b) -> a -> b -> (Array a b)
primitive arrayEq : {n, a} (Array [n] a) -> (Array [n] a) -> Bool

primitive arrayCopy : {n, a} (Array [n] a) -> [n] -> (Array [n] a) -> [n] -> [n] -> (Array [n] a)

primitive arraySet : {n, a} (Array [n] a) -> [n] -> a -> [n] -> (Array [n] a)

primitive arrayRangeEqual : {n, a} (Array [n] a) -> [n] -> (Array [n] a) -> [n] -> [n] -> Bool

arrayRangeLookup : {a, b, n} (Integral a, fin n, LiteralLessThan n a) => (Array a b) -> a -> [n]b
arrayRangeLookup arr idx = res
  where
    res @ i = arrayLookup arr (idx + i)

arrayRangeUpdate : {a, b, n} (Integral a, fin n, LiteralLessThan n a) => (Array a b) -> a -> [n]b -> (Array a b)
arrayRangeUpdate arr idx vals = arrs ! 0
  where
    arrs = [arr] # [ arrayUpdate acc (idx + i) val | acc <- arrs | i <- [0 ..< n] | val <- vals ]
```
Return exactly ONE fenced code block labeled `cryptol` and nothing else (no prose before/after).

Define a Cryptol module `SuiteB` that specifies AES-128/192/256 key schedules and block encryption/decryption plus SHA-224/256/384/512 functions, and include any necessary types, primitives, and helper functions as in the snippet.

```cryptol
module SuiteB where

type AES128 = 4

type AES192 = 6

type AES256 = 8

type AESRoundKey = [4][32]

type AESEncryptKeySchedule k =
  { aesEncInitialKey : AESRoundKey
  , aesEncRoundKeys  : [k+5]AESRoundKey
  , aesEncFinalKey   : AESRoundKey
  }

type AESDecryptKeySchedule k =
  { aesDecInitialKey : AESRoundKey
  , aesDecRoundKeys  : [k+5]AESRoundKey
  , aesDecFinalKey   : AESRoundKey
  }

aes128EncryptSchedule : [128] -> AESEncryptKeySchedule AES128
aes128EncryptSchedule = aesExpandEncryptSchedule

aes128DecryptSchedule : [128] -> AESDecryptKeySchedule AES128
aes128DecryptSchedule = aesExpandDecryptSchedule

aes128Schedules : [128] -> (AESEncryptKeySchedule AES128, AESDecryptKeySchedule AES128)
aes128Schedules = aesExpandSchedules

aes192EncryptSchedule : [192] -> AESEncryptKeySchedule AES192
aes192EncryptSchedule = aesExpandEncryptSchedule

aes192DecryptSchedule : [192] -> AESDecryptKeySchedule AES192
aes192DecryptSchedule = aesExpandDecryptSchedule

aes192Schedules : [192] -> (AESEncryptKeySchedule AES192, AESDecryptKeySchedule AES192)
aes192Schedules = aesExpandSchedules

aes256EncryptSchedule : [256] -> AESEncryptKeySchedule AES256
aes256EncryptSchedule = aesExpandEncryptSchedule

aes256DecryptSchedule : [256] -> AESDecryptKeySchedule AES256
aes256DecryptSchedule = aesExpandDecryptSchedule

aes256Schedules : [256] -> (AESEncryptKeySchedule AES256, AESDecryptKeySchedule AES256)
aes256Schedules = aesExpandSchedules

aesEncryptBlock : {k} (fin k) => AESEncryptKeySchedule k -> [128] -> [128]
aesEncryptBlock schedule plaintext = rnf (join final)
  where
  final = (AESEncFinalRound (rds!0)) ^ schedule.aesEncFinalKey

  rds = [ schedule.aesEncInitialKey ^ split plaintext ] #
        [ AESEncRound r ^ rdk
        | rdk <- schedule.aesEncRoundKeys
        | r   <- rds
        ]

aesDecryptBlock : {k} (fin k) => AESDecryptKeySchedule k -> [128] -> [128]
aesDecryptBlock schedule cyphertext = rnf (join final)
  where
  final = (AESDecFinalRound (rds!0)) ^ schedule.aesDecFinalKey

  rds = [ split cyphertext ^ schedule.aesDecInitialKey ] #
        [ AESDecRound r ^ rdk
        | rdk <- schedule.aesDecRoundKeys
        | r   <- rds
        ]

private
    aesExpandEncryptSchedule : {k} (fin k, k >= 4, 8 >= k) => [k * 32] -> AESEncryptKeySchedule k
    aesExpandEncryptSchedule key = rnf
         { aesEncInitialKey = ks @  0
         , aesEncRoundKeys  = ks @@ [ 1 .. k+5 ]
         , aesEncFinalKey   = ks @  `(k+6)
         }
      where
      ks : [k+7]AESRoundKey
      ks = groupBy`{4} (AESKeyExpand`{k} (split key))

    aesEncToDecSchedule : {k} (fin k) => AESEncryptKeySchedule k -> AESDecryptKeySchedule k
    aesEncToDecSchedule enc = rnf
       { aesDecInitialKey = enc.aesEncFinalKey
       , aesDecRoundKeys  = map AESInvMixColumns (reverse (enc.aesEncRoundKeys))
       , aesDecFinalKey   = enc.aesEncInitialKey
       }

    aesExpandDecryptSchedule : {k} (fin k, k >= 4, 8 >= k) => [k * 32] -> AESDecryptKeySchedule k
    aesExpandDecryptSchedule key = aesEncToDecSchedule (aesExpandEncryptSchedule key)

    aesExpandSchedules : {k} (fin k, k >= 4, 8 >= k) => [k * 32] -> (AESEncryptKeySchedule k, AESDecryptKeySchedule k)
    aesExpandSchedules key = (encS, aesEncToDecSchedule encS)
      where encS = aesExpandEncryptSchedule key

    primitive AESEncRound      : [4][32] -> [4][32]
    primitive AESEncFinalRound : [4][32] -> [4][32]
    primitive AESDecRound      : [4][32] -> [4][32]
    primitive AESDecFinalRound : [4][32] -> [4][32]
    primitive AESInvMixColumns : [4][32] -> [4][32]
    primitive AESKeyExpand     : {k} (fin k, k >= 4, 8 >= k) => [k][32] -> [4*(k+7)][32]

sha224 : {L} (fin L) => [L] -> [224]
sha224 msg = join (processSHA2_224 (sha2blocks`{32} msg))

sha256 : {L} (fin L) => [L] -> [256]
sha256 msg = join (processSHA2_256 (sha2blocks`{32} msg))

sha384 : {L} (fin L) => [L] -> [384]
sha384 msg = join (processSHA2_384 (sha2blocks`{64} msg))

sha512 : {L} (fin L) => [L] -> [512]
sha512 msg = join (processSHA2_512 (sha2blocks`{64} msg))

private
    type sha2_block_size w = 16 * w
    type sha2_num_blocks w L = (L+1+2*w) /^ sha2_block_size w
    type sha2_padded_size w L = sha2_num_blocks w L * sha2_block_size w

    sha2pad : {w, L} (fin w, fin L, w >= 1) => [L] -> [sha2_padded_size w L]
    sha2pad M = rnf (M # 0b1 # zero # ((fromInteger `L) : [2*w]))

    sha2blocks : {w, L} (fin w, fin L, w >= 1) =>
      [L] -> [sha2_num_blocks w L][16][w]
    sha2blocks msg = [ split x | x <- split (sha2pad`{w} msg) ]

    primitive processSHA2_224 : {n} (fin n) => [n][16][32] -> [7][32]

    primitive processSHA2_256 : {n} (fin n) => [n][16][32] -> [8][32]

    primitive processSHA2_384 : {n} (fin n) => [n][16][64] -> [6][64]

    primitive processSHA2_512 : {n} (fin n) => [n][16][64] -> [8][64]
```
Return exactly ONE fenced code block labeled `cryptol` and nothing else (no prose before/after).

Write a Cryptol module that defines IEEE-754 style floating-point types Float16/32/64/128/256, rounding modes, and primitives (e.g., fpAdd, fpSub, fpMul, fpDiv, fpFMA, fpSqrt, fpFromBits, fpToBits, fpIsNaN/Inf/Zero/Normal/Subnormal, fpFromRational, fpToRational) with the same interfaces.

```cryptol
module Float where

primitive type ValidFloat : # -> # -> Prop

primitive type { exponent : #, precision : #}
  ValidFloat exponent precision => Float exponent precision : *

type Float16  = Float 5 11

type Float32  = Float 8 24

type Float64  = Float 11 53

type Float128 = Float 15 113

type Float256 = Float 19 237

type RoundingMode = [3]

roundNearestEven, rne : RoundingMode
roundNearestEven = 0
rne              = roundNearestEven

roundNearestAway, rna : RoundingMode
roundNearestAway  = 1
rna               = roundNearestAway

roundPositive, rtp : RoundingMode
roundPositive     = 2
rtp               = roundPositive

roundNegative, rtn : RoundingMode
roundNegative     = 3
rtn               = roundNegative

roundZero, rtz : RoundingMode
roundZero         = 4
rtz               = roundZero

primitive
  fpNaN : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p

primitive
  fpPosInf : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p

fpNegInf : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p
fpNegInf = - fpPosInf

fpPosZero : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p
fpPosZero = zero

fpNegZero : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p
fpNegZero = - fpPosZero

primitive
  fpFromBits : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => [e + p] -> Float e p

primitive
  fpToBits : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> [e + p]

primitive
  (=.=) : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Float e p -> Bool

infix 20 =.=

primitive fpIsNaN : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool

primitive fpIsInf : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool

primitive fpIsZero : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool

primitive fpIsNeg : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool

primitive fpIsNormal : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool

primitive fpIsSubnormal : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool

fpIsFinite : {e,p} ValidFloat e p => Float e p -> Bool
fpIsFinite f = ~ (fpIsNaN f \/ fpIsInf f )

primitive
  fpAdd : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Float e p -> Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpSub : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Float e p -> Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpMul : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Float e p -> Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpDiv : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Float e p -> Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpFMA : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Float e p -> Float e p -> Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpAbs : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpSqrt : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Float e p -> Float e p

primitive
  fpToRational : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    Float e p -> Rational

primitive
  fpFromRational : {e,p} ValidFloat e p =>
    RoundingMode -> Rational -> Float e p
```
Return exactly ONE fenced code block labeled `cryptol` and nothing else (no prose before/after).

Define a Cryptol module `Cryptol` that provides the core prelude: primitive numeric and logical types, bitvector and sequence operations, comparison and arithmetic classes, folds/maps/zips, sorting, and utility functions, with the same names, types, infix declarations, and properties as in the standard Cryptol prelude.

```cryptol
module Cryptol where

infixr  5 ==>
infixr 10 \/
infixr 15 /\
infix  20 ==, ===, !=, !==
infix  30 >, >=, <, <=, <$, >$, <=$, >=$
infixr 40 ||
infixl 45 ^
infixr 50 &&
infixr 60 #
infixl 70 <<, <<<, >>, >>>, >>$
infixl 80 +, -
infixl 90 *, /, %, /$, %$, %^, /^
infixr 95 ^^
infixl 100 @, @@, !, !!

primitive type Bit : *

primitive type Integer : *

primitive type {n : #} (fin n, n >= 1) => Z n : *

primitive type Rational : *

type Bool = Bit
type Word n = [n]
type Char = [8]
type String n = [n]Char

primitive type inf : #

primitive type (==) : # -> # -> Prop

primitive type (!=) : # -> # -> Prop

primitive type (>=) : # -> # -> Prop

primitive type fin : # -> Prop

primitive type prime : # -> Prop

primitive type (+) : # -> # -> #

primitive type (*) : # -> # -> #

primitive type
  {m : #, n : # }
  (fin n, m >= n) =>
  m - n : #

primitive type
  { m : #, n : # }
  (fin m, n >= 1) =>
  m / n : #

primitive type
  { m : #, n : # }
  (fin m, n >= 1) =>
  m % n : #

primitive type (^^) : # -> # -> #

primitive type width : # -> #

type lg2 n = width (max n 1 - 1)

primitive type min : # -> # -> #

primitive type max : # -> # -> #

primitive type
  { m : #, n : # }
  (fin n, n >= 1) =>
  m /^ n : #

primitive type
  { m : #, n : # }
  (fin n, n >= 1) =>
  m %^ n : #

primitive type
  { start : #, next : #, last : # }
  (fin start, fin next, fin last, start != next) =>
  lengthFromThenTo start next last : #

type constraint i <= j = (j >= i)

type constraint i > j = i >= j + 1

type constraint i < j = j >= i + 1

primitive type Literal : # -> * -> Prop

primitive type LiteralLessThan : # -> * -> Prop

primitive number : {val, rep} Literal val rep => rep

demote : {val, rep} Literal val rep => rep
demote = number`{val}

length : {n, a, b} (fin n, Literal n b) => [n]a -> b
length _ = `n

primitive fromTo : {first, last, a}
  (fin last, last >= first, Literal last a) =>
  [1 + (last - first)]a

primitive fromToLessThan :
  {first, bound, a} (fin first, bound >= first, LiteralLessThan bound a) =>
  [bound - first]a

primitive fromToBy : {first, last, stride, a}
  (fin last, fin stride, stride >= 1, last >= first, Literal last a) =>
  [1 + (last - first)/stride]a

primitive fromToByLessThan : {first, bound, stride, a}
  (fin first, fin stride, stride >= 1, bound >= first, LiteralLessThan bound a) =>
  [(bound - first)/^stride]a

primitive fromToDownBy : {first, last, stride, a}
  (fin first, fin stride, stride >= 1, first >= last, Literal first a) =>
  [1 + (first - last)/stride]a

primitive fromToDownByGreaterThan : {first, bound, stride, a}
  (fin first, fin stride, stride >= 1, first >= bound, Literal first a) =>
  [(first - bound)/^stride]a

primitive fromThenTo : {first, next, last, a, len}
                       ( fin first, fin next, fin last
                       , Literal first a, Literal next a, Literal last a
                       , first != next
                       , lengthFromThenTo first next last == len) => [len]a

primitive type FLiteral : # -> # -> # -> * -> Prop

primitive
  fraction : { m, n, r, a } FLiteral m n r a => a

primitive type Zero : * -> Prop

primitive zero : {a} (Zero a) => a

primitive type Logic : * -> Prop

primitive (&&) : {a} (Logic a) => a -> a -> a

primitive (||) : {a} (Logic a) => a -> a -> a

primitive (^) : {a} (Logic a) => a -> a -> a

primitive complement : {a} (Logic a) => a -> a

primitive type Ring : * -> Prop

primitive fromInteger : {a} (Ring a) => Integer -> a

primitive (+) : {a} (Ring a) => a -> a -> a

primitive (-) : {a} (Ring a) => a -> a -> a

primitive (*) : {a} (Ring a) => a -> a -> a

primitive negate : {a} (Ring a) => a -> a

primitive type Integral : * -> Prop

primitive (/) : {a} (Integral a) => a -> a -> a

primitive (%) : {a} (Integral a) => a -> a -> a

primitive toInteger : {a} (Integral a) => a -> Integer

primitive (^^) : {a, e} (Ring a, Integral e) => a -> e -> a

primitive infFrom : {a} (Integral a) => a -> [inf]a

primitive infFromThen : {a} (Integral a) => a -> a -> [inf]a

primitive type Field : * -> Prop

primitive recip : {a} (Field a) => a -> a

primitive (/.) : {a} (Field a) => a -> a -> a

primitive type Round : * -> Prop

primitive ceiling : {a} (Round a) => a -> Integer

primitive floor : {a} (Round a) => a -> Integer

primitive trunc : {a} (Round a) => a -> Integer

primitive roundAway : {a} (Round a) => a -> Integer

primitive roundToEven : {a} (Round a) => a -> Integer

primitive type Eq : * -> Prop

primitive (==) : {a} (Eq a) => a -> a -> Bit

primitive (!=) : {a} (Eq a) => a -> a -> Bit

(===) : {a, b} (Eq b) => (a -> b) -> (a -> b) -> (a -> Bit)
f === g = \ x -> f x == g x

(!==) : {a, b} (Eq b) => (a -> b) -> (a -> b) -> (a -> Bit)
f !== g = \x -> f x != g x

primitive type Cmp : * -> Prop

primitive (<) : {a} (Cmp a) => a -> a -> Bit

primitive (>) : {a} (Cmp a) => a -> a -> Bit

primitive (<=) : {a} (Cmp a) => a -> a -> Bit

primitive (>=) : {a} (Cmp a) => a -> a -> Bit

min : {a} (Cmp a) => a -> a -> a
min x y = if x < y then x else y

max : {a} (Cmp a) => a -> a -> a
max x y = if x > y then x else y

abs : {a} (Cmp a, Ring a) => a -> a
abs x = if x < fromInteger 0 then negate x else x

primitive type SignedCmp : * -> Prop

primitive (<$) : {a} (SignedCmp a) => a -> a -> Bit

(>$) : {a} (SignedCmp a) => a -> a -> Bit
x >$ y = y <$ x

(<=$) : {a} (SignedCmp a) => a -> a -> Bit
x <=$ y = ~(y <$ x)

(>=$) : {a} (SignedCmp a) => a -> a -> Bit
x >=$ y = ~(x <$ y)

enum Option a = None | Some a

enum Result t e = Ok t | Err e

primitive True  : Bit

primitive False : Bit

(/\) : Bit -> Bit -> Bit
x /\ y = if x then y else False

(\/) : Bit -> Bit -> Bit
x \/ y = if x then True else y

(==>) : Bit -> Bit -> Bit
a ==> b = if a then b else True

primitive (/$) : {n} (fin n, n >= 1) => [n] -> [n] -> [n]

primitive (%$) : {n} (fin n, n >= 1) => [n] -> [n] -> [n]

carry : {n} (fin n) => [n] -> [n] -> Bit
carry x y = (x + y) < x

scarry : {n} (fin n, n >= 1) => [n] -> [n] -> Bit
scarry x y = (sx == sy) && (sx != sz)
  where
    z  = x + y
    sx = head x
    sy = head y
    sz = head z

sborrow : {n} (fin n, n >= 1) => [n] -> [n] -> Bit
sborrow x y = ( x <$ (x-y) ) ^ head y

zext : {m, n} (fin m, m >= n) => [n] -> [m]
zext x = zero # x

sext : {m, n} (fin m, m >= n, n >= 1) => [n] -> [m]
sext x = newbits # x
  where newbits = if head x then ~zero else zero

primitive (>>$) : {n, ix} (fin n, n >= 1, Integral ix) => [n] -> ix -> [n]

primitive lg2 : {n} (fin n) => [n] -> [n]

primitive toSignedInteger : {n} (fin n, n >= 1) => [n] -> Integer

primitive ratio : Integer -> Integer -> Rational

primitive fromZ : {n} (fin n, n >= 1) => Z n -> Integer

primitive (#) : {front, back, a} (fin front) => [front]a -> [back]a
                                             -> [front + back] a

splitAt : {front, back, a} (fin front) => [front + back]a
                                       -> ([front]a, [back]a)
splitAt xs = (take`{front,back} xs, drop`{front,back} xs)

primitive join : {parts, each, a} (fin each) => [parts][each]a
                                             -> [parts * each]a

primitive split : {parts, each, a} (fin each) => [parts * each]a
                                              -> [parts][each]a

primitive reverse : {n, a} (fin n) => [n]a -> [n]a

primitive transpose : {rows, cols, a} [rows][cols]a -> [cols][rows]a

primitive take : {front, back, a} [front + back]a -> [front]a

primitive drop : {front, back, a} (fin front) => [front + back]a -> [back]a

tail : {n, a} [1 + n]a -> [n]a
tail xs = drop`{1} xs

head : {n, a} [1 + n]a -> a
head xs = xs @ (0 : Integer)

last : {n, a} (fin n) => [1 + n]a -> a
last xs = xs ! (0 : Integer)

groupBy : {each, parts, a} (fin each) => [parts * each]a -> [parts][each]a
groupBy = split`{parts=parts}

primitive (<<) : {n, ix, a} (Integral ix, Zero a) => [n]a -> ix -> [n]a

primitive (>>) : {n, ix, a} (Integral ix, Zero a) => [n]a -> ix -> [n]a

primitive (<<<) : {n, ix, a} (fin n, Integral ix) => [n]a -> ix -> [n]a

primitive (>>>) : {n, ix, a} (fin n, Integral ix) => [n]a -> ix -> [n]a

primitive (@) : {n, a, ix} (Integral ix) => [n]a -> ix -> a

(@@) : {n, k, ix, a} (Integral ix) => [n]a -> [k]ix -> [k]a
xs @@ is = [ xs @ i | i <- is ]

primitive (!) : {n, a, ix} (fin n, Integral ix) => [n]a -> ix -> a

(!!) : {n, k, ix, a} (fin n, Integral ix) => [n]a -> [k]ix -> [k]a
xs !! is = [ xs ! i | i <- is ]

primitive update : {n, a, ix} (Integral ix) => [n]a -> ix -> a -> [n]a

primitive updateEnd : {n, a, ix} (fin n, Integral ix) => [n]a -> ix -> a -> [n]a

updates : {n, k, ix, a} (Integral ix, fin k) => [n]a -> [k]ix -> [k]a -> [n]a
updates xs0 idxs vals = foldl upd xs0 (zip idxs vals)
  where
    upd xs (i,b) = update xs i b

updatesEnd : {n, k, ix, a} (fin n, Integral ix, fin k) => [n]a -> [k]ix -> [k]a -> [n]a
updatesEnd xs0 idxs vals = foldl upd xs0 (zip idxs vals)
  where
    upd xs (i,b) = updateEnd xs i b

generate : {n, a, ix} (Integral ix, LiteralLessThan n ix) => (ix -> a) -> [n]a
generate f = [ f i | i <- [0 .. <n] ]

sort : {a, n} (Cmp a, fin n) => [n]a -> [n]a
sort = sortBy (<=)

sortBy : {a, n} (fin n) => (a -> a -> Bit) -> [n]a -> [n]a
sortBy le ((xs : [n/2]a) # (ys : [n/^2]a)) = take zs.0
  where
    xs' = if `(n/2)  == (1 : Integer) then xs else sortBy le xs
    ys' = if `(n/^2) == (1 : Integer) then ys else sortBy le ys
    zs  = [ if i == `(n/2)        then (ys'@j, i  , j+1)
             | j == `(n/^2)       then (xs'@i, i+1, j  )
             | le (xs'@i) (ys'@j) then (xs'@i, i+1, j  )
            else                       (ys'@j, i  , j+1)
          | (_, i , j) <- [ (undefined, 0 : Integer, 0 : Integer) ] # zs
          ]

primitive pmult : {u, v} (fin u, fin v) => [1 + u] -> [1 + v] -> [1 + u + v]

primitive pdiv : {u, v} (fin u, fin v) => [u] -> [v] -> [u]

primitive pmod : {u, v} (fin u, fin v) => [u] -> [1 + v] -> [v]

primitive parmap : {a, b, n} (Eq b, fin n) => (a -> b) -> [n]a -> [n]b

primitive deepseq : {a, b} Eq a => a -> b -> b

rnf : {a} Eq a => a -> a
rnf x = deepseq x x

primitive error : {a, n} (fin n) => String n -> a

undefined : {a} a
undefined = error "undefined"

assert : {a, n} (fin n) => Bit -> String n -> a -> a
assert pred msg x = if pred then x else error msg

primitive random : {a} [256] -> a

primitive trace : {n, a, b} (fin n) => String n -> a -> b -> b

traceVal : {n, a} (fin n) => String n -> a -> a
traceVal msg x = trace msg x x

and : {n} (fin n) => [n]Bit -> Bit
and xs = ~zero == xs

or : {n} (fin n) => [n]Bit -> Bit
or xs = zero != xs

all : {n, a} (fin n) => (a -> Bit) -> [n]a -> Bit
all f xs = foldl' (/\) True (map f xs)

/**
 * Disjunction after applying a predicate to all elements.
 */
any : {n, a} (fin n) => (a -> Bit) -> [n]a -> Bit
any f xs = foldl' (\/) False (map f xs)

map : {n, a, b} (a -> b) -> [n]a -> [n]b
map f xs = [f x | x <- xs]

primitive foldl : {n, a, b} (fin n) => (a -> b -> a) -> a -> [n]b -> a

primitive foldl' : {n, a, b} (fin n, Eq a) => (a -> b -> a) -> a -> [n]b -> a

/**
 * Functional right fold.
 *
 * foldr (-) 0 [1,2,3] = 0 - (1 - (2 - 3))
 */
foldr : {n, a, b} (fin n) => (a -> b -> b) -> b -> [n]a -> b
foldr f acc xs = foldl g acc (reverse xs)
  where g b a = f a b

/**
 * Functional right fold, with strict evaluation of the accumulator value.
 * The accumulator is reduced to weak head normal form at each step.
 *
 * foldr' (-) 0 [1,2,3] = 0 - (1 - (2 - 3))
 */
foldr' : {n, a, b} (fin n, Eq b) => (a -> b -> b) -> b -> [n]a -> b
foldr' f acc xs = foldl' g acc (reverse xs)
  where g b a = f a b

/**
 * Compute the sum of the values in the sequence.
 */
sum : {n, a} (fin n, Eq a, Ring a) => [n]a -> a
sum xs = foldl' (+) (fromInteger 0) xs

product : {n, a} (fin n, Eq a, Ring a) => [n]a -> a
product xs = foldl' (*) (fromInteger 1) xs

/**
 * Scan left is like a foldl that also emits the intermediate values.
 */
primitive scanl : {n, a, b}  (a -> b -> a) -> a -> [n]b -> [1+n]a

/**
 * Scan right is like a foldr that also emits the intermediate values.
 */
scanr : {n, a, b} (fin n) => (a -> b -> b) -> b -> [n]a -> [1+n]b
scanr f acc xs = reverse (scanl (\a b -> f b a) acc (reverse xs))

/**
 * Repeat a value.
 */
repeat : {n, a} a -> [n]a
repeat x = [ x | _ <- zero : [n] ]

/**
 * 'elem x xs' returns true if x is equal to a value in xs.
 */
elem : {n, a} (fin n, Eq a) => a -> [n]a -> Bit
elem a xs = any (\x -> x == a) xs

/**
 * Create a list of tuples from two lists.
 */
zip : {n, a, b} [n]a -> [n]b -> [n](a, b)
zip xs ys = [(x,y) | x <- xs | y <- ys]

/**
 * Create a list by applying the function to each pair of elements in the input.
 */
zipWith : {n, a, b, c} (a -> b -> c) -> [n]a -> [n]b -> [n]c
zipWith f xs ys = [f x y | x <- xs | y <- ys]

/**
 * Transform a function into uncurried form.
 */
uncurry : {a, b, c} (a -> b -> c) -> (a, b) -> c
uncurry f = \(a, b) -> f a b

/**
 * Transform a function into curried form.
 */
curry : {a, b, c} ((a, b) -> c) -> a -> b -> c
curry f = \a b -> f (a, b)

/**
 * Map a function iteratively over a seed value, producing an infinite
 * list of successive function applications.
 */
iterate : {a} (a -> a) -> a -> [inf]a
iterate f z = scanl (\x _ -> f x) z (zero:[inf]())
```
Return exactly ONE fenced code block labeled `cryptol` and nothing else (no prose before/after).

Define a Cryptol module `Cryptol::Reference` that implements polynomial multiplication `pmult`, division `pdiv`, and modulus `pmod` over GF(2), plus generic higher-order functions `foldl`, `scanl`, and `iterate`, with the same polymorphic types and behaviors as described.

```cryptol
module Cryptol::Reference where

pmult : {u, v} (fin u, fin v) => [1 + u] -> [1 + v] -> [1 + u + v]
pmult x y = last zs
  where
    zs = [0] # [ (z << 1) ^ (if yi then 0 # x else 0) | yi <- y | z <- zs ]

pdiv : {u, v} (fin u, fin v) => [u] -> [v] -> [u]
pdiv x y = [ z ! degree | z <- zs ]
  where
    degree : [width v]
    degree = last (ds : [1 + v]_)
      where ds = [0/0] # [if yi then i else d | yi <- reverse y | i <- [0..v] | d <- ds ]

    reduce : [v] -> [v]
    reduce u = if u ! degree then u ^ y else u

    zs : [u][v]
    zs = [ tail (reduce z # [xi]) | z <- [0] # zs | xi <- x ]

pmod : {u, v} (fin u, fin v) => [u] -> [1 + v] -> [v]
pmod x y = if y == 0 then 0/0 else last zs
  where
    degree : [width v]
    degree = last (ds : [2 + v]_)
      where ds = [0/0] # [if yi then i else d | yi <- reverse y | i <- [0..v] | d <- ds ]

    reduce : [1 + v] -> [1 + v]
    reduce u = if u ! degree then u ^ y else u

    powers : [inf][1 + v]
    powers = [reduce 1] # [ reduce (p << 1) | p <- powers ]

    zs = [0] # [ z ^ (if xi then tail p else 0) | xi <- reverse x | p <- powers | z <- zs ]

foldl : {n, a, b} (fin n) => (a -> b -> a) -> a -> [n]b -> a
foldl f z bs = last (scanl f z bs)

scanl : {n, a, b}  (a -> b -> a) -> a -> [n]b -> [1+n]a
scanl f z bs = as
  where
    as = [z] # [ f a b | a <- as | b <- bs ]

iterate : {a} (a -> a) -> a -> [inf]a
iterate f z = xs
  where xs = [z] # [ f x | x <- xs ]
```
